segment.source: Configuring the Company Settings Center for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Configuring the Company Settings Center for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Configuring the Company Settings Center for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Configuring the Company Settings Center for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Configuring the Company Settings Center for UE-V 2.x
segment.target: Configuring the Company Settings Center for UE-V 2.x

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, and 2.1 SP1 include a new application, the Company Settings Center, which helps users manage settings to synchronize.
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) 2.0, 2.1, and 2.1 SP1 include a new application, the Company Settings Center, which helps users manage settings to synchronize.

segment.source: The Company Settings Center is installed by using the UE-V Agent.
segment.target: The Company Settings Center is installed by using the UE-V Agent.

segment.source: Users access the Company Settings Center in Control Panel, in the Start menu or on the Start screen, and via the UE-V notification area icon.
segment.target: Users access the Company Settings Center in Control Panel, in the Start menu or on the Start screen, and via the UE-V notification area icon.

segment.source: Company Settings Center displays which settings are synchronized and helps users see the synchronization status of UE-V.
segment.target: Company Settings Center displays which settings are synchronized and helps users see the synchronization status of UE-V.

segment.source: Users can use the Company Settings Center to select which applications or Windows features synchronize their settings between computers.
segment.target: Users can use the Company Settings Center to select which applications or Windows features synchronize their settings between computers.

segment.source: They can also click the Sync Now button to synchronize all settings immediately.
segment.target: They can also click the Sync Now button to synchronize all settings immediately.

segment.source: The administrator can also include a link for support in the Company Settings Center.
segment.target: The administrator can also include a link for support in the Company Settings Center.

segment.source: About the Company Settings Center
segment.target: About the Company Settings Center

segment.source: The Company Settings Center desktop application provides users with information about UE-V settings synchronization.
segment.target: The Company Settings Center desktop application provides users with information about UE-V settings synchronization.

segment.source: The Company Settings Center is accessible in several different ways:
segment.target: The Company Settings Center is accessible in several different ways:

segment.source: Notification area icon – With the Tray Icon Group Policy setting or Windows PowerShell configuration enabled, the UE-V icon appears in the notification area.
segment.target: Notification area icon – With the Tray Icon Group Policy setting or Windows PowerShell configuration enabled, the UE-V icon appears in the notification area.

segment.source: Click the UE-V icon to open the Company Settings Center.
segment.target: Click the UE-V icon to open the Company Settings Center.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The notification area icon can be disabled by using the following settings:
segment.target: The notification area icon can be disabled by using the following settings:

segment.source: Group Policy setting:
segment.target: Group Policy setting:

segment.source: Windows PowerShell cmdlet:
segment.target: Windows PowerShell cmdlet:

segment.source: Configuration item in the UE-V Configuration Pack for System Center 2012 Configuration Manager:
segment.target: Configuration item in the UE-V Configuration Pack for System Center 2012 Configuration Manager:

segment.source: Control Panel application – In Control Panel, browse to Appearance and Personalization, and then click Company Settings Center.
segment.target: Control Panel application – In Control Panel, browse to Appearance and Personalization, and then click Company Settings Center.

segment.source: First use notification – Unless disabled, the UE-V Agent alerts the user that settings are now synchronized when the UE-V agent runs for the first time on a computer.
segment.target: First use notification – Unless disabled, the UE-V Agent alerts the user that settings are now synchronized when the UE-V agent runs for the first time on a computer.

segment.source: Click the notification dialog box to open the Company Settings Center.
segment.target: Click the notification dialog box to open the Company Settings Center.

segment.source: The Start screen or Start menu includes a link to the Company Settings Center.
segment.target: The Start screen or Start menu includes a link to the Company Settings Center.

segment.source: A search for Company Settings Center finds the application.
segment.target: A search for Company Settings Center finds the application.

segment.source: Configuring the support link in the Company Settings Center
segment.target: Configuring the support link in the Company Settings Center

segment.source: The Company Settings Center can include a hyperlink that users can click to get support with UE-V settings synchronization problems.
segment.target: The Company Settings Center can include a hyperlink that users can click to get support with UE-V settings synchronization problems.

segment.source: This link can open any valid URL protocol, such as http:// for a webpage or mailto:// for an email.
segment.target: This link can open any valid URL protocol, such as http:// for a webpage or mailto:// for an email.

segment.source: The support link can be configured by using Group Policy, Windows PowerShell, or the System Center 2012 Configuration Manager UE-V Configuration Pack.
segment.target: The support link can be configured by using Group Policy, Windows PowerShell, or the System Center 2012 Configuration Manager UE-V Configuration Pack.

segment.source: How to configure the Company Settings Center support link
segment.target: How to configure the Company Settings Center support link

segment.source: Open your preferred management tool:
segment.target: Open your preferred management tool:

segment.source: Group Policy - If you have not already done so, download the ADMX template for UE-V 2 from MDOP Administrative Templates.
segment.target: Group Policy - If you have not already done so, download the ADMX template for UE-V 2 from MDOP Administrative Templates.

segment.source: Windows PowerShell – On a computer with the UE-V Agent installed, open Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: Windows PowerShell – On a computer with the UE-V Agent installed, open Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: For more information about administering UE-V by using Windows PowerShell, see Administering UE-V 2.x with Windows PowerShell and WMI.
segment.target: For more information about administering UE-V by using Windows PowerShell, see Administering UE-V 2.x with Windows PowerShell and WMI.

segment.source: System Center 2012 Configuration Pack for Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) – Import the UE-V Configuration Pack and follow the Configuration Pack documentation to create configuration items.
segment.target: System Center 2012 Configuration Pack for Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) – Import the UE-V Configuration Pack and follow the Configuration Pack documentation to create configuration items.

segment.source: For more information about the UE-V Configuration Pack, see Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012.
segment.target: For more information about the UE-V Configuration Pack, see Configuring UE-V 2.x with System Center Configuration Manager 2012.

segment.source: Edit the settings for the following policies:
segment.target: Edit the settings for the following policies:

segment.source: Contact IT Link Text - This setting specifies the text of the Contact IT URL hyperlink in the Company Settings Center.
segment.target: Contact IT Link Text - This setting specifies the text of the Contact IT URL hyperlink in the Company Settings Center.

segment.source: If you enable this setting, the Company Settings Center displays the specified text in the link to the Contact IT URL.
segment.target: If you enable this setting, the Company Settings Center displays the specified text in the link to the Contact IT URL.

segment.target: Group Policy settings:

segment.source: Windows PowerShell cmdlet:
segment.target: Windows PowerShell cmdlet:

segment.source: Configuration Pack configuration item:
segment.target: Configuration Pack configuration item:

segment.source: Contact IT URL - This setting specifies the URL for the Contact IT link in the Company Settings Center in a valid URL protocol, such as http:// for a webpage or mailto:// for an email.
segment.target: Contact IT URL - This setting specifies the URL for the Contact IT link in the Company Settings Center in a valid URL protocol, such as http:// for a webpage or mailto:// for an email.

segment.target: Group Policy settings:

segment.target: Windows PowerShell cmdlet:

segment.target: Configuration Pack configuration item:

segment.source: Deploy settings to users’ computers by using the management tool.
segment.target: Deploy settings to users’ computers by using the management tool.
